{"blocks":[{"key":"435op","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fe441","text":"Additional Materials","type":"header-one","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5si9s","text":"The Dicty Stock Center accepts antibodies, cDNA and genomic libraries, and other materials people would like to share. The cost for most items on this page is $ 40.-, for the GWDI pooled libraries $ 100.- is the price. These prices are  for customers of non-profit institutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":159,"length":7,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":197,"length":7,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cut14","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6qtu","text":"If you would like to send additional materials, or would like to obtain the materials listed below, please contact dictystocks@northwestern.edu.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":115,"length":28,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"9kqql","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n6uh","text":"GWDI pooled library, REMI-seq project Thompson and Harwood labs","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":21,"length":16,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9j1ov","text":"Each GWDI pool is $100.-; the pools are a limited resource. Therefore, we would like each lab to order the resource not more than once. It is key when hatching/thawing to follow instructions for growing and storage of further aliquots. Here you can get the REMI-seq Handbook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":18,"length":6,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":178,"length":12,"key":2},{"offset":257,"length":17,"key":3}],"data":{}},{"key":"9nqsr","text":"DNA libraries","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es3vi","text":"Genomic Library pools from the Shaulsky lab ","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a34d","text":"Details of the genomic library can be found in Rosengarten et al. 2015. A 96-well plate with 32 pools of the library in TSA Big Easy E. coli, will be shipped on dry ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":59,"length":2,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":133,"length":7,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":47,"length":23,"key":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"90bdv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30nba","text":"Antibodies","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"507mo","text":"Monoclonal antibodies ( MUD 1, MUD 3, MUD 4, MUD 9, MUD 5, MUD 10) generated against prespore and prestalk cell membrane proteins during the slug stage. 10mg/ml solutions in 1 ml aliquots.
The antibodies were given by M. Krefft to Salvo Bozzaro who deposited to the DSC. References: Gregg et al. 1982, Krefft et al. 1983
Some are published and described in detail:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":24,"length":41,"style":"BOLD"},{"offset":231,"length":13,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":283,"length":17,"key":5},{"offset":302,"length":18,"key":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"5nc4m","text":"MUD 1 recognizes a cell surface antigen of prespore cells ( Krefft et al. 1984, Krefft et al. 1985)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":5,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":60,"length":18,"key":7},{"offset":80,"length":18,"key":8}],"data":{}},{"key":"dh3n2","text":"MUD 3 recognizes a protein on the surface of spores ( Voet et al. 1985)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":5,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":54,"length":16,"key":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"a1or5","text":"MUD 9 labels prestalk cells but also vegetative cells ( Krefft et al. 1989, Krefft et al. 1985)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":5,"style":"BOLD"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":56,"length":18,"key":10},{"offset":76,"length":18,"key":11}],"data":{}},{"key":"5muk5","text":"Anti-calmodulin monoclonal antibodies ( calA ). Deposited by Margaret Clarke.
There are several mouse monoclonal with different specificities (see paper for details): 2D1, 1F11, 4C5, 6D4, 20B9, and 15E7. Certain of those monoclonals are also availablel from Sigma and other commercial sources. Immunoblotting calmodulin requires special techniques, as described in the paper.
Reference: Hulen et al. 1991.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":40,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":48,"length":29,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":40,"length":4,"key":12},{"offset":387,"length":17,"key":13}],"data":{}},{"key":"c1vaf","text":"Anti-calmodulin polyclonal antiserum ( calA ). Deposited by Margaret Clarke.
These antisera (B88, B89) probably cross-react with other calmodulin-like proteins in Dictyostelium. Reference: Zhu et al. 1993.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":39,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":47,"length":29,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":163,"length":13,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":39,"length":4,"key":14},{"offset":189,"length":15,"key":15}],"data":{}},{"key":"aeufm","text":"Anti-cluA monoclonal antibody ( cluA ). Deposited by Margaret Clarke.
The 10D5 mouse monoclonal antibodies. Reference: Zhu et al. 1997.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":32,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":40,"length":29,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":32,"length":4,"key":16},{"offset":119,"length":15,"key":17}],"data":{}},{"key":"dmi2k","text":"Anti-myosin II heavy chain monoclonal antibodies ( mhcA ). Deposited by Margaret Clarke.
There are four different mouse monoclonals: M342, M151, M98 and M27. M342 binds specifically to monomeric myosin in solution, presumably because the epitope is not accessible in thick filaments.
References: Reines & Clarke 1985a, Reines & Clarke 1985b.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":51,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":59,"length":29,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":51,"length":4,"key":18},{"offset":296,"length":21,"key":19},{"offset":319,"length":21,"key":20}],"data":{}},{"key":"ek34b","text":"Anti-ribosomal protein L7 antibody ( rpl7 ). Reference: Szymkowski et al. 1989.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":37,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":37,"length":4,"key":21},{"offset":56,"length":22,"key":22}],"data":{}},{"key":"3vhri","text":"Anti-discoidin-I polyclonal antiserum ( dscA ). Deposited by Margaret Clarke.
Antisera from two different rabbits (Y355, Y356). Reference: Rathi and Clarke 1992.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":40,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":48,"length":29,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":40,"length":4,"key":23},{"offset":139,"length":21,"key":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"b1t4c","text":"Anti-vatA monoclonal antibody ( vatA ). Deposited by Margaret Clarke.
The N1 and N4 mouse monoclonal antibodies were generated by Agnes Fok at the University of Hawaii. Reference: Fok et al. 1993.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":32,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":40,"length":29,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":32,"length":4,"key":25},{"offset":180,"length":15,"key":26}],"data":{}},{"key":"2g4m0","text":"Anti-vatM monoclonal antibody ( vatM ). Deposited by Margaret Clarke.
The N2 mouse monoclonal antibodies were generated by Agnes Fok at the University of Hawaii. Reference: Fok et al. 1993.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":32,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":40,"length":29,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":32,"length":4,"key":27},{"offset":173,"length":15,"key":28}],"data":{}},{"key":"b0dcl","text":"Anti-dimB antibody ( dimB ). Deposited by Yoko Yamada, Jeff Williams
Raised in Rabbit; use at a titre of 1/5000. References: Zhukovskaya et al. 2006 and Yamada et al. 2013","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":21,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":29,"length":39,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":21,"length":4,"key":29},{"offset":125,"length":23,"key":30},{"offset":153,"length":18,"key":31}],"data":{}},{"key":"3of2s","text":"Anti-dimB-phosphoS5090P antibody ( dimB ). Deposited by Yoko Yamada, Jeff Williams
Raised in Sheep; use at a titre of 1/300. Reference: Fukuzawa et al. 2001.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":35,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":43,"length":39,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":35,"length":4,"key":32},{"offset":136,"length":20,"key":33}],"data":{}},{"key":"1acoo","text":"Anti-statc-total-7H3 antibody ( dstC ). Deposited by Tsuyoshi Araki, Jeff Williams
Raised in Mouse; use at a titre of 1/500 – 1/1000. Reference: Fukuzawa et al. 2001.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":32,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":40,"length":42,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":32,"length":4,"key":34},{"offset":145,"length":20,"key":35}],"data":{}},{"key":"71n2d","text":"Anti-statc-phospho-CP22 antibody ( dstC ). Deposited by by Tsuyoshi Araki, Jeff Williams
Raised in Mouse; use at a titre of 1/300 – 1/500. Reference: Fukuzawa et al. 2001.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":35,"length":5,"style":"ITALIC"},{"offset":43,"length":45,"style":"ITALIC"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":35,"length":4,"key":36},{"offset":150,"length":20,"key":37}],"data":{}},{"key":"493gi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brcmr","text":"Monoclonal Dictyostelium antibodies are also available from the Developmental Studies Hybridoma Bank
